content.description: Let f and g be the functions given by f(x) = ex and g(x) = ln x.
content.question: Find the volume of the solid generated when the region enclosed by the graphs of f and g between x = <math> <mrow> <mfrac> <mn>1</mn> <mn>2</mn> </mfrac> </mrow> </math> and x = 1 is revolved about the line y = 4.

frqParts.text: Find the volume of the solid generated when the region enclosed by the graphs of f and g between x = <math> <mrow> <mfrac> <mn>1</mn> <mn>2</mn> </mfrac> </mrow> </math> and x = 1 is revolved about the line y = 4.

topic.text: 8.12: Volume with Washer Method - Revolving Around Other Axes

skill.text: Skill 2.D: Identify how mathematical characteristics or properties of functions are related in different representations.
